media:group.media:title: 13 days, 13 donuts
media:group.media:description: The Bakers Dozen is a new #nft project to raise money for Blender! Donut #1 lists 3PM PDT Monday, Donut #2 Tuesday and so on. Explore the collection: https://foundation.app/collection/13donuts?sortOrder=DEFAULT

entry.title: How to make a Hologram in Blender in 15 minutes

media:group.media:title: How to make a Hologram in Blender in 15 minutes
media:group.media:description:

entry.title: How to Make a Realistic Earth in Blender in 20 mins

media:group.media:title: How to Make a Realistic Earth in Blender in 20 mins
media:group.media:description:
Blender tutorial showing you the surprisingly easy method to create a photorealistic earth. Using 100% Blender and some textures from the good ole boys and gals at NASA.
Download NASA Textures: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/1rxblwi19i78ieh/AADNsHNRA7SysJ015GkXplewa?dl=0 Download NASA Reference Photos: https://www.dropbox.com/sh/3ghuz4477c45aw7/AAAlo1-kNTQMqLPHzqRwkZFba?dl=0 Download the new Poliigon Addon: https://www.poliigon.com/blender?utm_campaign=addon&utm_source=yt&utm_medium=bg&utm_content=tut NASA Imagery Use Policy: https://visibleearth.nasa.gov/image-use-policy
Join my free email newsletter: https://www.blenderguru.com/thisweekin3D

entry.title: Beginner Blender Geometry Node Tutorial - Part 2

media:group.media:title: Beginner Blender Geometry Node Tutorial - Part 2
media:group.media:description:
This Blender tutorial shows you how to use Geometry Nodes to create sugar coated candy.
Part 1: https://youtu.be/aO0eUnu0hO0
NFT series goes live October 3rd 2022. Visit https://andrewprice.art/ for more details.
Download the final .blend file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/9zukqldna7fuiql/BlenderGuru_SugarCoatedCandy.blend?dl=0
0:00 Exposing values 1:40 The importance of real-world scale 3:08 Why object scale impacts point density 4:47 Making values more usable 6:28 The importance of labelling 7:54 Modelling the candy 9:09 Reducing point intersections 11:19 Materials, lighting, camera 13:16 The NFT

entry.title: How to make an LED sign in Blender

media:group.media:title: How to make an LED sign in Blender
media:group.media:description:
Blender tutorial showing you how to use geometry nodes to create an LED ticker screen. Perfect for virtual subways!
Links: Pop Warner Font: https://www.dafont.com/pop-warner.font Download the final .blend: https://www.dropbox.com/s/oqnb0nc7skyp10u/BlenderGuru_LED_Screen.blend?dl=0 Poliigon: https://www.poliigon.com/?utm_campaign=led-tut&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=desc&utm_content=led-tut Hand Smudges texture: https://www.poliigon.com/texture/hand-smudges-type-b-medium-001/2387?utm_campaign=led-tut&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=desc&utm_content=led-tut Scratches texture: https://www.poliigon.com/texture/scratches-light-014/1595?utm_campaign=led-tut&utm_source=youtube.com&utm_medium=desc&utm_content=led-tut Watch BlenderBrit's RGB LED Tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9ozn1G67ngQ
Chapter marks: 0:00 Creating the board 2:26 Instancing LEDs 4:33 LED bulb materials 6:41 Using text to drive the LEDs 11:25 The problem with keyframe animations 12:59 Creating animations with geometry nodes 14:21 Snapping the animation to LEDs 18:38 Improving the text 20:44 Improving the usability 26:40 Final Node Setup

media:group.media:title: You're Wrong About NFTs
media:group.media:description:
NFTs have attracted quite a bit of heat lately, and only some of that is deserved. It's not about getting rich, but it is about money.
Chapters 0:00 How Art Became Free 3:46 The Paywall 5:10 The Case For NFTs 9:47 The Three Types of NFT Buyers 12:47 The Case Against NFTs 16:16 The Next 3-5 Years of NFTs 18:00 The Donut?

media:group.media:title: Blender 3.0 Beginner Rendering Tutorial (Donut part 15)
media:group.media:description:
Blender tutorial on understanding all the render settings of Cycles and Eevee. We'll discuss samples, noise thresholds, the biggest time speed up (SSS OFF!), motion blur, DoF (depth of field), and Eevee render settings.
Join Poliigon: Poliigon: http://www.poliigon.com/?utm_campaign=donut3&utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=video
Chapters: 0:00 Intro 0:49 Cycles Rendering: Samples 05:25 Noise Threshold 10:31 Subsurface Scattering: OFF 12:46 Motion blur 13:38 Depth of field 15:28 Persistent Data 16:18 Hardware Device 17:10 Light Paths 19:53 Eevee Rendering Setup 22:25 Contact shadows 25:00 Screenspace reflections 25:30 Ambient Occlusion 26:54 Eevee samples 27:53 Final render settings
Join my free email newsletter: https://www.blenderguru.com/thisweekin3D

media:group.media:title: Blender 3.0 Beginner Compositing Tutorial (Donut part 14)
media:group.media:description:
Blender tutorial on using the built-in compositor to change background colors, add gradients, specular glare, color grading, chromatic aberration and sharpening.
